sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The buckler of the faith: or, A defence of the confession of faith of the reformed churches in France, against the obiections of M. Arnoux the Iesuite Wherein all the principall controuersies betweene the reformed churches and the Church of Rome are decided. Written in French by Peter du Moulin minister of the word of God in Paris: and now translated into English. Bouclier de la foy. English Du Moulin, Pierre, 1568-1658.
[34], 560, [8] p.
Printed by R[ichard] F[ield] for Nathanael Newbery, and are to be sold at the signe of the Starre vnder Saint Peters Church in Cornhill, and in Popes head Alley, London : 1620.
A translation of: Bouclier de la foy. A reply to: Arnoux, Jean. La confession de foy de messieurs les ministres convaincüe de nullité par leur propre bible. Printer's name from STC. With "An aduertisement to the reader" inserted after A8. With three final contents leaves. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
The buckler of the faith: or, A defence of the confession of faith of the reformed churches in France, against the obiections of M. Arnoux the Iesuite Wherein all the principall controuersies betweene the reformed churches and the Church of Rome are decided. Written in French by Peter du Moulin minister of the word of God in Paris: and now translated into English. Bouclier de la foy. English Du Moulin, Pierre, 1568-1658.
[34], 560, [8] p.
Printed by R[ichard] F[ield] for Nathanael Newbery, and are to be sold at the signe of the Starre vnder Saint Peters Church in Cornhill, and in Popes head Alley, London : 1620.
A translation of: Bouclier de la foy. A reply to: Arnoux, Jean. La confession de foy de messieurs les ministres convaincüe de nullité par leur propre bible. Printer's name from STC. With "An aduertisement to the reader" inserted after A8. With three final contents leaves. The first leaf and the last leaf are blank. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Nathanael Newbery
R[ichard] F[ield]
Popes head Alley
the signe of the Starre vnder Saint Peters Church in Cornhill
